title: Banana Bread
ingredients: 3/4 cup sugar (or 1/2 cup for less sweet; brown sugar works too)
Optional: 1/2 cup chopped nuts, chocolate chips, or dried fruit
steps: 1. Prep
Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
Grease or line a 9x5-inch loaf pan with parchment paper.
Fit your KitchenAid with the paddle attachment.
2. Mixing (with speed settings)
Mash Bananas
Add peeled bananas to the bowl.
Turn to Speed 2 for about 30 seconds until mashed.
Add Butter
Pour in melted butter.
Mix on Speed 2 until combined (about 20â€“30 seconds).
Incorporate Sugar, Egg, Vanilla
Add sugar, then the beaten egg, then vanilla.
Mix on Speed 4 for 1â€“2 minutes until smooth and slightly fluffy.
Dry Ingredients
Add baking soda and salt.
With the mixer on Stir (Speed 1), gradually add flour in two batches.
Mix only until you no longer see streaks of flour (do not overmix).
Optional Add-ins
Add nuts, chocolate chips, or dried fruit.
Mix on Stir (Speed 1) just until combined (10â€“15 seconds).
3. Bake
Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50â€“60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.
âœ… Pro Tip: If you want a lighter texture, after step 3 (sugar/egg/vanilla), let the mixer run on Speed 6 for 1 minute to whip a bit more air into the batter before adding flour.

title: Empanadas
ingredients: Â½ cup (115 g) unsalted butter or lard, cold and cut into small cubes
1 tbsp vinegar or lemon juice (optional, makes dough more tender)
steps: Step-by-Step with KitchenAid
Mix dry ingredients
Add flour and salt to the mixer bowl.
Use the paddle attachment on low speed to combine.
Add fat
Drop in the cold butter (or lard) cubes.
Mix on low until the mixture looks sandy or crumbly (pea-sized pieces are fine).
Add wet ingredients
In a small bowl, whisk the egg with vinegar (if using).
Add to the mixer while running on low.
Add water gradually
Slowly pour in ice water, a tablespoon at a time, until the dough just comes together.
It should be soft but not sticky.
Switch to dough hook (optional)
Knead on low speed for about 1â€“2 minutes until smooth. Donâ€™t overwork it â€” empanada dough should stay tender.
Rest the dough
Shape into a disc, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (up to overnight). This relaxes the gluten and firms the fat.
Roll & cut
Roll dough out on a floured surface to about â…›" thick.
Cut into 4â€“6 inch rounds (a bowl or large cutter works well).
Fill & bake/fry
Add your filling, fold, crimp edges, and cook as desired.

title: Biscuits
ingredients: 1 tbsp sugar (optional, for a hint of sweetness)
Â½ cup (1 stick) cold unsalted butter, cut into cubes
steps: 1. Prep your mixer
Fit your KitchenAid with the paddle attachment (not the dough hookâ€”you want to keep the dough tender).
2. Mix dry ingredients
Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar to the bowl.
Mix on low speed just until combined.
3. Cut in the butter
Add cold butter cubes to the flour mixture.
Run the mixer on low speed until the butter pieces are about pea-sized.
(The butter should stay cold and a little chunkyâ€”this is what creates flaky layers.)
4. Add buttermilk
Pour in cold buttermilk.
Mix on low speed until the dough just comes together.
(It will look shaggyâ€”donâ€™t overmix.)
5. Shape the dough
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
Gently pat or roll it into a 1-inch thick rectangle.
Fold it in half, turn, and gently flatten again. Repeat 2â€“3 times (this helps create layers).
6. Cut biscuits
Pat dough to about Â¾â€“1 inch thickness.
Use a round cutter (donâ€™t twist, just press straight down).
Place biscuits on a parchment-lined baking sheet, close together for softer sides, or spaced apart for crisper edges.
7. Bake
Brush tops with a little melted butter or buttermilk.
Bake at 425Â°F (220Â°C) for 12â€“15 minutes, until golden brown.
Tips for Success
Keep ingredients coldâ€”cold butter = flaky biscuits.
Donâ€™t overmix once liquid is added.
For extra tall biscuits, chill cut biscuits for 10 minutes before baking.

title: Hashbrowns
steps: Peel and shred the potatoes
Peel the potatoes (optional if you like skin-on hashbrowns).
Use the large holes of a box grater or a food processor with a shredding disc.
Remove excess starch and moisture
Place the shredded potatoes into a bowl of cold water and swish them around to remove starch.
Drain, then squeeze out as much water as possible using a clean kitchen towel or cheesecloth.
(This step helps them crisp up instead of steaming.)
Preheat your pan
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 2â€“3 tbsp of oil, butter, or a mix of both.
Cook the hashbrowns
Spread the shredded potatoes evenly in the hot pan.
Press down gently with a spatula to form a flat layer.
Let them cook undisturbed for 5â€“7 minutes, until the bottom is golden brown and crispy.
Flip and finish
Carefully flip sections of the potatoes (they may break apart, thatâ€™s okay).
Cook the other side for another 5â€“7 minutes until crispy.
Season and serve
Sprinkle with salt and pepper while hot.
Serve as a side with eggs, bacon, or your favorite breakfast dish.
âœ¨ Pro tip: For extra flavor, mix in finely diced onions, garlic powder, or paprika before cooking.

title: ğŸƒ Roll
ingredients: â…” cup pumpkin purÃ©e (not pie filling)
Powdered sugar (for dusting towel & top of roll)
steps: 1. Prepare Pan & Towel
Preheat oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
Line a 10x15-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper, lightly greased.
Lay out a clean kitchen towel and dust generously with powdered sugar (this keeps cake from sticking when rolled).
2. Make the Pumpkin Cake
In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices.
In mixer bowl, beat eggs and sugar until thick and light (about 2â€“3 minutes).
Mix in pumpkin and vanilla.
Gently fold in dry ingredients until just combined.
Spread batter evenly into prepared pan.
3. Bake & Roll
Bake 11â€“13 minutes, until the cake springs back when touched.
Immediately loosen edges, invert cake onto prepared towel.
Peel off parchment paper.
Starting from the short end, roll cake and towel together into a log.
Let cool completely (at least 1 hour).
4. Make Cream Cheese Filling
Beat cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
5. Fill & Re-roll
Carefully unroll cooled cake.
Spread cream cheese filling evenly, leaving a small border.
Re-roll cake (without towel) tightly.
Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour to set.
6. Serve
Dust with powdered sugar before slicing.
Keeps in the fridge for up to 4 days; freezes well too.

title: Pasta Sauce
ingredients: 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes (or fresh peeled tomatoes if you have them)
Â½ tsp red pepper flakes (optional, for a little heat)
Fresh basil leaves (or 1 tsp dried basil)
steps: 1. SautÃ© the base
Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until soft (about 5 minutes).
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds (donâ€™t let it burn).
2. Add tomatoes & seasoning
Pour in crushed tomatoes.
Add oregano, sugar (if using), pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Stir well.
3. Simmer
Reduce heat to low and let sauce simmer 20â€“30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Sauce will thicken and flavors will meld.
4. Finish with basil
Stir in fresh basil at the end for brightness.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Variations
Chunkier sauce: Use diced tomatoes instead of crushed.
Meat sauce: Brown ground beef, pork, or sausage before adding onions.
Creamy tomato sauce: Stir in a splash of heavy cream or half & half before serving.
Veggie boost: Add shredded carrots, zucchini, or bell peppers when cooking onions.

title: Pizza
ingredients: 3 Â½ to 4 cups all-purpose flour (or bread flour for chewier crust)
2 Â¼ tsp active dry yeast (1 packet)
steps: 1. Activate Yeast
In the mixer bowl, combine warm water, sugar, and yeast.
Let sit 5â€“10 minutes until foamy. (If it doesnâ€™t foam, the yeast may be dead.)
2. Add Ingredients
Add olive oil, salt, and 2 Â½ cups flour.
Fit the mixer with the dough hook attachment.
3. Mix & Knead
Start on low speed (2) to bring dough together.
Gradually add the remaining flour, Â¼ cup at a time, until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl (slightly tacky but not sticky).
Knead with the mixer on speed 2 for 5â€“7 minutes, until dough is smooth and elastic.
4. First Rise
Lightly oil a large bowl, place dough inside, and cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel.
Let rise in a warm place for 1â€“1.5 hours, until doubled in size.
5. Shape & Second Rise
Punch down dough and divide into 2 portions.
Roll/stretch into pizza rounds.
If time allows, let rest 10â€“15 minutes for easier stretching.
6. Bake
Preheat oven to 475Â°F (245Â°C) with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside.
Add sauce, cheese, and toppings.
Bake 12â€“15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbly.
âœ… Tips for best results:
Use bread flour for a chewier crust.
For extra flavor, let dough cold ferment in the fridge for 24â€“48 hours after step 4.
Brush edges with olive oil for a crispier, golden crust.

title: Butter
ingredients: 2 cups heavy cream (cold, not ultra-pasteurized if possible)
Pinch of salt (optional, for salted butter)
KitchenAid stand mixer with whisk or paddle attachment
steps: 1. Set Up
Pour cold heavy cream into the mixer bowl.
Attach the whisk (for faster separation) or paddle (for slightly chunkier butter).
2. Whip the Cream
Start at speed 2â€“4 until cream thickens.
Increase to speed 8â€“10 once it becomes whipped cream.
Keep mixingâ€”after about 8â€“10 minutes total, it will clump and separate into yellow butter solids and liquid buttermilk.
3. Drain the Buttermilk
Place a strainer over a bowl.
Pour contents through, separating the buttermilk (save it for pancakes, biscuits, etc.).
4. Wash the Butter
Put butter solids back into the mixer bowl.
Add very cold water, mix gently, then pour off the cloudy liquid.
Repeat until the water runs clear (removes leftover buttermilk so butter lasts longer).
5. Season & Store
Sprinkle in salt if desired, mixing briefly to combine.
Shape butter with a spatula, press out excess liquid, and store in an airtight container.
Refrigerated: lasts about 1â€“2 weeks.
Frozen: lasts several months.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: 1. Set Up Mixer
Fit your KitchenAid with the flat beater/paddle attachment (best for cookies).
2. Cream Butter & Sugars
Add softened butter, white sugar, and brown sugar to the bowl.
Start on speed 2 (low) so it doesnâ€™t fly out, then increase to speed 4â€“6.
Mix until creamy and fluffy (about 2â€“3 minutes).
3. Add Eggs & Vanilla
Crack in eggs one at a time while the mixer runs on low.
Add vanilla.
Mix until combined (donâ€™t overmix).
4. Add Dry Ingredients
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Slowly add this to the mixer on low speed (stir/2).
Scrape down the bowl once or twice to ensure all flour is incorporated.
5. Mix in Chocolate Chips
Pour in chocolate chips.
Run mixer on stir/low until evenly distributed.
6. Shape & Bake
Scoop dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet (about 1â€“2 tbsp per cookie).
Bake at 350Â°F (175Â°C) for 9â€“12 minutes, until edges are golden.
Let cool on the pan for 2 minutes, then move to a wire rack.
âœ… Tips with the KitchenAid:
Always start on low speed when adding dry ingredients.
The paddle attachment works best (whisk = too much air, dough hook = too heavy).
Donâ€™t overmix after adding flourâ€”just until combined.

title: Pasta Noodles
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour (or â€œ00â€ flour for silkier texture)
1 tsp olive oil (optional, makes dough smoother)
(This makes enough for 2â€“3 servings. Scale up if needed.)
Fit your KitchenAid with the flat beater.
Add flour and salt to the mixer bowl.
Switch to the dough hook and knead on speed 2 for 5â€“7 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic.
If too dry â†’ add 1 tsp water at a time. If too sticky â†’ sprinkle in a little flour.
Form into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap, and let rest at room temp 30 minutes.
This relaxes the gluten and makes rolling easier.
ğŸ¥˜ Step 3: Roll Out (with pasta roller attachment)
Cut dough into 4 pieces. Keep unused pieces covered.
Flatten one piece slightly by hand.
Run dough through. Fold in thirds (like a letter) and roll again 2â€“3 times to smooth it.
Gradually reduce thickness setting (2 â†’ 3 â†’ 4, etc.) until desired thinness (usually 5â€“6 for fettuccine/lasagna, 6â€“7 for spaghetti).
Switch to the pasta cutter attachment (fettuccine or spaghetti).
Feed sheets through to cut into noodles.
Dust lightly with flour or semolina so they donâ€™t stick.
Boil in salted water for just 2â€“3 minutes (fresh pasta cooks fast).
Toss with your favorite sauce and enjoy!
